elements.content: A series of one-dimensional (1-D) telluridoindate compounds built from InTe4 tetrahedra sharing opposite edges were synthesized, and the structures of the {[InTe2 -]}∞ chains were classified as three types. Compound [Zn(taa)(μ-tren)0.5][InTe2]Cl (Ia) has a common structure feature of a 1-D straight chain (type I). Compounds [M(en)3]In2Te4·en (M = Ni (IIa) and Co (IIb)) have a sinusoidal 1-D structure with [In4Te8] 4- periodic units (type II), while compounds [M(en)3]2(en)0.5In4Te8 (M = Mn (IIIa), Fe (IIIb), and Zn (IIIc)) show another type of sinusoidal anionic chain (type III). The repeating unit of type III consists of eight edge-sharing tetrahedra for a complete sinusoidal period, [In8Te16 8-] n . Although numerous 1-D polymeric anion chains built from MQ4 tetrahedra with the formula of {[MQ2] n -}∞ exist, these chains are usually straight. The compounds of types II and III are rare examples of 1-D chains within main group chalcogenometalates.

The repeating unit of type III consists of eight edge-sharing tetrahedra for a complete sinusoidal period, [In8Te16 8-] n . Although numerous 1-D polymeric anion chains built from MQ4 tetrahedra with the formula of {[MQ2] n  -}∞ exist, these chains are usually straight. The compounds of types II and III are rare examples of 1-D chains within main group chalcogenometalates.

elements.content: Low-dimensional materials have attracted great attention of chemists and physicists for several decades because of their inherent anisotropic physical−chemical properties. Among these materials, one-dimensional (1-D) chains with the formula {[MQ2] n -}∞ (M = metal, Q = S, Se, Te) represent a typical family of 1-D structures (Zweier single chain). The anions of these compounds have a common structural character such that the 1-D chains are constructed by MQ4 tetrahedra sharing opposite edges (Figure ). The 1-D {MQ2} or {MM‘Q4} compounds, such as SiS2, AFeQ2 (A = K, Rb and Q = S, Se), [NH4][CuMoS4], Pd2MQ2 (M = Fe, Co, Ni and Q = Se, Te), MInQ2 (M = Na, K, Rb, Tl; Q = Te, and M = Tl, Q = Se), TlGaTe2, Aln2Te4 (A = Ca, Sr, Ba6), AA‘2Se4 (A = Ba, Ca, A‘= Ga, Al), and K2HgSnTe4, are usually obtained by a flux growth technique at intermediate or higher temperatures. In addition, similar compounds obtained by solvothermal reactions or cathodic dissolution include [C10N4H26]0.5[InS2], [C10N4H26]0.5[GaS2], (C4H11N2)GaSe2, [(C4H9)4N]2In2Te4, (Et4N)2HgSnTe4, and (Ph4P)GeInTe4, whose counterions are protonated amine, tetra-alkylammonium, or tetraphenylphosphonium ions, and [2,2,2-crypt-Na]2[Tl2Se4]en, [La(en)4Cl]In2Te4, and [M(en)3]0.5[GaS2] (M = Mn, Co, Ni), whose counterions are metal complexes. The tetrahedra in these anionic chains usually take a C 2 v (or Td ) symmetry with the C 2 axis along the chain axis, which ensures all the central metals arrange in a straight line.
elements.clean_text:
Introduction

Low-dimensional materials have attracted great attention of chemists and physicists for several decades because of their inherent anisotropic physical-chemical properties. Among these materials, one-dimensional (1-D) chains with the formula {[MQ2] n  -}∞ (M = metal, Q = S, Se, Te) represent a typical family of 1-D structures (Zweier single chain). The anions of these compounds have a common structural character such that the 1-D chains are constructed by MQ4 tetrahedra sharing opposite edges (Figure ). The 1-D {MQ2} or {MM‘Q4} compounds, such as SiS2, AFeQ2 (A = K, Rb and Q = S, Se), [NH4][CuMoS4], Pd2MQ2 (M = Fe, Co, Ni and Q = Se, Te), MInQ2 (M = Na, K, Rb, Tl; Q = Te, and M = Tl, Q = Se), TlGaTe2, Aln2Te4 (A = Ca, Sr, Ba6), AA‘2Se4 (A = Ba, Ca, A‘= Ga, Al), and K2HgSnTe4, are usually obtained by a flux growth technique at intermediate or higher temperatures. In addition, similar compounds obtained by solvothermal reactions or cathodic dissolution include [C10N4H26]0.5[InS2], [C10N4H26]0.5[GaS2], (C4H11N2)GaSe2, [(C4H9)4N]2In2Te4, (Et4N)2HgSnTe4, and (Ph4P)GeInTe4, whose counterions are protonated amine, tetra-alkylammonium, or tetraphenylphosphonium ions, and [2,2,2-crypt-Na]2[Tl2Se4]en, [La(en)4Cl]In2Te4, and [M(en)3]0.5[GaS2] (M = Mn, Co, Ni), whose counterions are metal complexes. The tetrahedra in these anionic chains usually take a C 2  v  (or Td ) symmetry with the C 2 axis along the chain axis, which ensures all the central metals arrange in a straight line.

elements.content: A number of binary and ternary indium tellurides with 0−3-dimensional structures have been prepared by convenient low-temperature synthetic techniques. Among them, [InTe2] - and [In2Te6]2- chains are the most common 1-D structures. The 1-D structure of [In2Te6]2- anion is constructed from fused five-membered rings of [(In3+)2(Te2 2-)(Te2-)] joined at the In atoms, such as (Ph4P)2In2Te6, [M(en)3](In2Te6) (M = Fe, Zn), α- and β-[Mo3(en)3(μ2-Te2)3(μ3-Te)(μ3-O)]In2Te6. However, only two examples exist in [La(en)4Cl]In2Te4 16 and [(C4H9)4N]2In2Te4, built from edge-sharing tetrahedra. In this manuscript, we report a new discovery of the types of 1-D chains with the formula of {[MQ2] n -}∞. A series of indium telluridoindate [Zn(tren)(μ-taa)0.5][InTe2]Cl (Ia), [M(en)3]In2Te4·en (M = Ni (IIa) and Co (IIb)), and [M(en)3]2In4Te8·(en)0.5 (M = Mn (IIIa), Fe (IIIb), and Zn (IIIc)) have been successfully prepared from the M(II)/In(III)/Te/tren(or en) (tren = triethylenetetramine, en = ethylenediamine) system under mild solvothermal conditions. The polymeric {[InTe2]-}∞ anion in Ia is similar to the aforementioned straight chain, while compounds IIa−IIb and IIIa−IIIc consist of unusual 1-D sinusoidal chains displaying two new types of repeating units.

However, only two examples exist in [La(en)4Cl]In2Te4 16 and [(C4H9)4N]2In2Te4, built from edge-sharing tetrahedra. In this manuscript, we report a new discovery of the types of 1-D chains with the formula of {[MQ2] n  -}∞. A series of indium telluridoindate [Zn(tren)(μ-taa)0.5][InTe2]Cl (Ia), [M(en)3]In2Te4⋅en (M = Ni (IIa) and Co (IIb)), and [M(en)3]2In4Te8⋅(en)0.5 (M = Mn (IIIa), Fe (IIIb), and Zn (IIIc)) have been successfully prepared from the M(II)/In(III)/Te/tren(or en) (tren = triethylenetetramine, en = ethylenediamine) system under mild solvothermal conditions. The polymeric {[InTe2]-}∞ anion in Ia is similar to the aforementioned straight chain, while compounds IIa-IIb and IIIa-IIIc consist of unusual 1-D sinusoidal chains displaying two new types of repeating units.

elements.content: General Remarks. All analytical grade chemicals were obtained commercially and used without further purification. Elemental analysis was conducted with an EA 1110 elemental analyzer. FT-IR spectra were recorded with a Nicolet Magna-IR 550 spectrometer in dry KBr disks in the 4000−400 cm-1 range. UV−vis spectra were measured with a Shimadzu UV-3150 spectrometer at room temperature. The absorption (α/S) data were calculated from the reflectance using the Kubelka−Munk function, α/S = (1 − R)2/2R, where R is the reflectance at a given energy, α is the absorption, and S is the scattering coefficient.
elements.clean_text:
Experimental Section

 General Remarks. All analytical grade chemicals were obtained commercially and used without further purification. Elemental analysis was conducted with an EA 1110 elemental analyzer. FT-IR spectra were recorded with a Nicolet Magna-IR 550 spectrometer in dry KBr disks in the 4000-400 cm-1 range. UV-vis spectra were measured with a Shimadzu UV-3150 spectrometer at room temperature. The absorption (α/S) data were calculated from the reflectance using the Kubelka-Munk function, α/S = (1 - R)2/2R, where R is the reflectance at a given energy, α is the absorption, and S is the scattering coefficient.

elements.content: Synthesis of Compounds. [Zn(taa)(μ-tren) 0.5 ][InTe 2 ]Cl (Ia). Single crystals of the complex suitable for X-ray crystallographic analysis were obtained by solvothermal reaction. The reagents of InCl3 (0.0442 mg, 0.2 mmol), ZnCl2·6H2O (0.0488 mg, 0.2 mmol), Te (0.0254 mg, 0.2 mmol), and tren (2 mL) were placed in a thick Pyrex tube (ca. 20 cm long). The sealed tube was heated at 180 °C for 7 days to yield yellow block-shaped crystals. The crystals were washed with ethanol and stored under vacuum (57% yield based on In). Elemental analysis Found:  C, 15.23%; H, 4.38%; N, 11.83%. Calc.:  C, 15.62%; H, 4.05%; N, 12.15%. IR (cm-1):  3442(m), 3256(vs), 3148(s), 3094(m), 2925(m), 2863(m), 2824(m), 1582(s), 1466(m), 1389(w), 1319(m), 1265(m), 1196(s), 1119(s), 1080(s), 1072(s), 987(m), 879(m), 779(m), 740(w), 648(m), 625(m), 532(m), 439(w).

elements.content: [Ni(en) 3 ]In 2 Te 4 ·en (IIa). Compound IIa was prepared by mixing InCl3 (0.0442 mg, 0.2 mmol), NiCl2·6H2O (0.0475 mg, 0.2 mmol), and Te (0.0254 mg, 0.2 mmol). elements.content: Crystal Structure Determination. Data collections were performed on a Rigaku Mercury CCD diffractometer using a ω-scan method with graphite monochromated Mo Kα radiation (λ = 0.071073 nm) at 173(2) K (IIa, IIIc), 193(2) K (IIIa, IIIb) and 223(2) K (Ia) to a maximum 2θ value (50.7°). The intensities were corrected for Lorentz and polarization effects. The structures were solved with direct methods using the SHELXS-97 program, and the refinement was performed against F 2 using SHELXL-97. All the non-hydrogen atoms were refined anisotropically. The hydrogen atoms were positioned with idealized geometry and refined with fixed isotropic displacement parameters. Relevant crystal and collection data parameters and refinement results can be found in Table . The structure of compound IIb is not of sufficiently high resolution for the low quality of the crystals, although the data have been collected many times. For this reason, the data of IIb are not listed in the Table (see Supporting Information material). Additional details of crystal data in CIF format can be found in the Supporting Information.

Description of the Structure of Anions. The 1-D chain of the {[InTe2]-}∞ anion in Ia can be described as InTe4 tetrahedra sharing opposite edges and it propagates along the crystallographic b-axis. The repeating unit contains two edge-sharing tetrahedra (In2Te4)2- with distances of 3.7976(9) and 3.7213(9) Å for In1−In2 and In2−In1A, respectively (symmetry operation:  (A) x, −1 + y, z) (Figure a). The period of the repeating unit is 7.5189 Å (In1−In2−In1), which is simply the sum of the two In−In distances and is equal to the unit cell length b (7.5189(8) Å). This chain possessing a common structure feature with the previously reported compounds2-17 is assigned to a straight-line type (type I). The details of this type have been discussed previously.

Results and Discussion

 Description of the Structure of Anions. The 1-D chain of the {[InTe2]-}∞ anion in Ia can be described as InTe4 tetrahedra sharing opposite edges and it propagates along the crystallographic b-axis. The repeating unit contains two edge-sharing tetrahedra (In2Te4)2- with distances of 3.7976(9) and 3.7213(9) Å for In1-In2 and In2-In1A, respectively (symmetry operation: (A) x, -1 + y, z) (Figure a). The period of the repeating unit is 7.5189 Å (In1-In2-In1), which is simply the sum of the two In-In distances and is equal to the unit cell length b (7.5189(8) Å). This chain possessing a common structure feature with the previously reported compounds2-17 is assigned to a straight-line type (type I). The details of this type have been discussed previously.

elements.content: The compounds [M(en)3]In2Te4·en (M = Ni (IIa) and Co (IIb)) are isostructural. The 1-D chain consists of [In4Te8] 4- periodic units formed by four InTe4 tetrahedra sharing opposite edges (type II) and propagates along the crystallographic b-axis, which shows a sinusoidal 1-D structure first found for {MQ2} n - anionic chains. There are two kinds of In−In distances in IIa, 3.7304(15) Å for In1−In2 and 3.6120(15) Å for In2−In1B (symmetry operation:  (B) x, 1.5 − y, 0.5 + z) (Figure b). The repeating sinusoidal unit of type II displays a period of 14.5452(23) Å (In1−In2 −In1−In2), which is less than the sum of the four In−In distances (14.6848 Å). The atoms in In1/Te1/Te2/In2 ring are almost coplanar, while the In1B/Te3/Te4/In2 ring has a butterfly structure; the dihedral angle between the wing planes In1B/Te3/In2 and In1B/Te4/In2 is 158.2°. When viewed down the [001] direction, the In atoms do not locate in a straight line. Figure b shows the separation of the In atoms and the two alternating orientations of the butterfly rings along the 1-D chain axis.

elements.content: Compounds IIIa−IIIc, which have the general formula of [M(en)3]2(en)0.5In4Te8 (M = Mn (IIIa), Fe (IIIb) and Zn (IIIc)), are isostructural, and IIIa is discussed here in detail. The 1-D polymeric structures of IIIa−IIIc are composed of another type of sinusoidal anionic chain [In8Te16 8-] n (type III), which runs along the [011] direction. The repeating unit of type III is different from that of type I and is similar to that of type II compounds, but it consists of eight edge-sharing tetrahedra for a complete sinusoidal period of 28.4569(37) Å (Figure c). There are five In−In separations of 3.6236(10), 3.6356(10), 3.6582(10), 3.6388(10), and 3.6345(9) Å for IIIa. The In1/Te1/Te1/In1 ring only slightly deviates from a plane while in the perpendicular direction; the In2/Te4/Te5/In3 ring significantly deviates from a plane taking a butterfly shape (Figure c).

elements.content: The fundamental units in the title compounds are tetrahedra of InTe4, in which the In atom is coordinated by four Te atoms. The four In−Te distances in a tetrahedron are different from each other for type II and type III compounds, but only two set of In−Te distances are in a tetrahedron of the type I compounds. The regular distorted and irregular distorted InTe4 tetrahedra are also reflected in the Te−In−Te angles of the compounds (type I, regular; type II and type III, irregular; see Supporting Information Tables −6). It should be noteworthy that the In−In distance in Ia is 3.759 Å (average), which is longer than those in IIa (3.671 Å (average)) and IIIa (3.638 Å (average)).

elements.content: Li's group has synthesized [La(en)4Cl]In2Te4 16 (brown, column) under solvothermal conditions from the LaCl3/InCl3/SrTe/Te/en system at 180 °C. The structure of [La(en)4Cl]In2Te4 consists of a type I anionic chain. In this work, the compounds were prepared using a method similar to that of Li's group. Yellow crystals of Ia were isolated from the ZnCl2/InCl3/Te/tren system at 180 °C, while the yellow crystals of compounds IIa−IIb and IIIa−IIIc were obtained from the MCl2/InCl3/Te/en (M = Mn, Co, Ni, Zn) or Fe/InCl3/Te/en system at 150 °C. The main difference in preparation for type I compounds and for other types of compounds is the temperature. Therefore, the reaction temperature had been raised up to 180 °C for all other reaction systems to understand the effect of the temperature, but compounds IIa−IIc and IIIa−IIIb were the only products in this reaction condition. Therefore, the metal complex cations should be important in directing the formation of different types of indium telluride chains.

elements.content: Effect of Cations and the Cocrystal lized en Molecules. The counterions to balance the charge of the binary indium telluride anions in the title compounds are transition-metal complex cations. In Ia, the tren molecule connects two [Zn(taa)]2+ units by the trans-terminal N atoms forming [Zn(taa)2(μ-tren)]4+ cations with a center of inversion (Figure ). N,N,N-tris(2-aminoethyl)amine (taa), which has an isostructure of tren with the same chemical formula, was formed by the rearrangement of tren in the solvothermal reaction. This phenomenon has been observed in [B5O7(OH)3Zn(taa)]. If the tren ligand had full symmetry, the trans-conformation of the cation would have the point group C 2 h . The tren molecule found in related coordination compounds usually acts as a strong chelate ligand, as exemplified by [M(tren)]2(μ2-Sn2S6) (TM = Co, Ni), [Mn(tren)]Sb2S4 and [Mn(tren)]2Sb2S5. The linear bridging coordination of tren is unfamiliar within the chalcogenidometalates. In IIa−IIb, there are one crystallographically independent [M(en)3]2+ (M = Ni and Co) cation and a free en molecule in the fundamental unit (Figure a, Supporting Information), while in IIIa−IIIc, there are two crystallographically independent [M(en)3]2+ (M = Mn, Fe, and Zn) cations and half a free en molecule in the fundamental unit (Figure b Supporting Information). A noteworthy point is the number of free en molecules that cocrystallized in these compounds. The number of en molecules in type II compounds is 1 and in type III compounds is 0.5, which are fixed for all the examples found displaying the same type, while no free en molecule is contained in type I compounds Ia and [La(en)4Cl]In2Te4. Although the relationship between the types and the number of en molecules is still unclear, it must be related to the N−H···Te hydrogen bonds and the space-filling.

elements.content: The structure of the {[Zn(taa)]2(μ-tren)}4+ cation in Ia.
elements.clean_text: 4  The structure of the {[Zn(taa)]2(μ-tren)}4+ cation in Ia.

elements.content: In Ia, the free Cl- ions are also involved in hydrogen bonding (N−H···Cl) with adjacent [Zn(taa)2(μ-tren)]4+ cations resulting in a two-dimensional (2-D) sheet parallel to the (100) plane (Figure Supporting Information). The infinite [InTe2]- chains are located between successive cationic layers yielding a sandwich-like arrangement. An interesting feature in type II compounds is that there exists N−H···N hydrogen-bonding assembled 1D en/[Ni(en)3]2+ channels with an alternating N···N distance of 3.02(2) and 3.08(2) Å (Figure ), in which the anionic chains are located. The 1-D [In4Te8]4- chains in IIIa−IIIc are separated by [M(en)3]2+ complexes in the [0 1̄ 1] direction with weak N···Te interactions of 3.560(5) and 3.601(5) Å and are separated by free en molecules in the [1 0 0] direction (Figure Supporting Information).
elements.clean_text: In Ia, the free Cl- ions are also involved in hydrogen bonding (N-H⋅⋅⋅Cl) with adjacent [Zn(taa)2(μ-tren)]4+ cations resulting in a two-dimensional (2-D) sheet parallel to the (100) plane (Figure  Supporting Information). The infinite [InTe2]- chains are located between successive cationic layers yielding a sandwich-like arrangement. An interesting feature in type II compounds is that there exists N-H⋅⋅⋅N hydrogen-bonding assembled 1D en/[Ni(en)3]2+ channels with an alternating N⋅⋅⋅N distance of 3.02(2) and 3.08(2) Å (Figure ), in which the anionic chains are located. The 1-D [In4Te8]4- chains in IIIa-IIIc are separated by [M(en)3]2+ complexes in the [0 1̄ 1] direction with weak N⋅⋅⋅Te interactions of 3.560(5) and 3.601(5) Å and are separated by free en molecules in the [1 0 0] direction (Figure  Supporting Information).

elements.content: Although numerous 1-D polymeric anion chains built from MQ4 tetrahedra sharing opposite edges with the formula of {[MQ2] n -}∞ exist, these chains are usually straight. However, types II and III are rare examples of 1-D infinite sinusoidal chains within the main group chalcogenometalates. The number of edge-sharing tetrahedra for a complete repeating period is 2, 4, and 8, respectively, for type I−III compounds. Is there a next type chain (IV) in which the number of edge-sharing tetrahedra is 16 (24)? What is the relationship between the cation's type or the number of free en molecules and the structures? These problems are those we are now faced with.
elements.clean_text:
Conclusion

Although numerous 1-D polymeric anion chains built from MQ4 tetrahedra sharing opposite edges with the formula of {[MQ2] n  -}∞ exist, these chains are usually straight. However, types II and III are rare examples of 1-D infinite sinusoidal chains within the main group chalcogenometalates. The number of edge-sharing tetrahedra for a complete repeating period is 2, 4, and 8, respectively, for type I-III compounds. Is there a next type chain (IV) in which the number of edge-sharing tetrahedra is 16 (24)? What is the relationship between the cation's type or the number of free en molecules and the structures? These problems are those we are now faced with.

Synthesis of Compounds. [Zn(taa)(μ-tren) 0.5 ][InTe 2 ]Cl (Ia). Single crystals of the complex suitable for X-ray crystallographic analysis were obtained by solvothermal reaction. The reagents of InCl3 (0.0442 mg, 0.2 mmol), ZnCl2·6H2O (0.0488 mg, 0.2 mmol), Te (0.0254 mg, 0.2 mmol), and tren (2 mL) were placed in a thick Pyrex tube (ca. 20 cm long). The sealed tube was heated at 180 °C for 7 days to yield yellow block-shaped crystals. The crystals were washed with ethanol and stored under vacuum (57% yield based on In). Elemental analysis Found:  C, 15.23%; H, 4.38%; N, 11.83%. Calc.:  C, 15.62%; H, 4.05%; N, 12.15%. IR (cm-1):  3442(m), 3256(vs), 3148(s), 3094(m), 2925(m), 2863(m), 2824(m), 1582(s), 1466(m), 1389(w), 1319(m), 1265(m), 1196(s), 1119(s), 1080(s), 1072(s), 987(m), 879(m), 779(m), 740(w), 648(m), 625(m), 532(m), 439(w).

[Ni(en) 3 ]In 2 Te 4 ·en (IIa). Compound IIa was prepared by mixing InCl3 (0.0442 mg, 0.2 mmol), NiCl2·6H2O (0.0475 mg, 0.2 mmol), and Te (0.0254 mg, 0.2 mmol). The mixture was then transferred to a thick-walled Pyrex tube, and 2 mL of en was added to it. The sealed tube was heated at 150 °C for 4 days to yield yellow block-shaped crystals (70% yield based on In).
